oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Camel Rock & Roll Dance Party - 1956-04-14 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS Rock 'N' Roll Dance Party program sponsored by Camel cigarettes, 1956-04-14 part 1. Hosted by Alan Freed with announcer Bern Bennett, starring Count Basie and his Orchestra with vocalist Joe Williams, and special guest stars LaVern Baker, and the Teenagers. Produced and directed by Lou Melamed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Count Basie Orchestra; LaVern Baker; Teenagers; Joe Williams
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Opening statement (Alan Freed) -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Bern Bennett) -- Alan Freed introduces Count Basie and his Orchestra -- You For Me (Count Basie Orchestra) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Alan Freed introduces LaVern Baker -- Play It Fair (LaVern Baker) -- Alan Freed introduces the Teenagers -- Why Do Fools Fall In Love (Teenagers) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial (Alan Freed) -- Alan Freed introduces Count Basie and his Orchestra with Joe Williams -- Every Day I Have The Blues (Joe Williams, Count Basie Orchestra)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; R.J. Reynolds Tobacco Company; Camel rock 'n roll dance party (Radio program); Freed, Alan; Bennett, Bern, 1921-2014; Basie, Count, 1904-1984; Count Basie Orchestra; Williams, Joe, 1918-1999; Foster, Frank, 1928-2011; Baker, LaVern; Lymon, Frankie; Teenagers (Musical group); Melamed, Louis
